intro: Haumaniastrum abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of this family. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits that contain seeds with tufts for wind dispersal. The plant is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
